12 def exit_gracefully(signum, frame):
13  signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, original_sigint)

17 def float_to_uint(number,v_min,v_max,bits):
18  number = number/(v_max-v_min)*2**bits
19  if (v_min != 0):
20  number = int(number + 2**bits/2)
21  else:
22  number = int(number)
23  return number

27 import rospy
28 from can_msgs.msg import Frame
29 import math
30 
31 rospy.init_node('motor_pinger')
32 can_command = rospy.Publisher('sent_messages', Frame, queue_size = 10)
33 
34 # We need to constantly publish something to get the info from the motor
35 # def ping_motor(self, data=[0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00]):
36 def ping_motor():
37  msg = Frame()
38  msg.id = 1
39  # Since this frame is just to request the data
40  # we set the rtr bit to True --> Just a remote frame
41  msg.is_rtr = True
42  msg.is_extended = False
43  msg.is_error = False
44  msg.dlc = 8
45  can_command.publish(msg)
46 
47 if __name__ == '__main__':
48  original_sigint = signal.getsignal(signal.SIGINT)
49  signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, exit_gracefully)
50  # Initiate the class
51  # Set rate
52  rate = rospy.Rate(50) # 10hz
53  # Then start the loop
54  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
55  ping_motor()
56  rate.sleep()
